question: Which of the following pairs is incorrect?
explanation:
• Nagarjuna Sagar Dam is one of the world\'s largest and tallest Masonry dams built across the Krishna River at Nagarjuna Sagar which straddles the border between Nalgonda District, Telangana State, India and Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh State, India.
• Farakka Barrage is a barrage across the Ganges River, located in Murshidabad district in the Indian state of West Bengal.
• The Tungabhadra River is a river in India that starts and flows through the state of Karnataka during most of its course before flowing into Andhra Pradesh.
• Kosi River is in Nepal and northern India. The river emerges on the great plain of northern India in Bihar state.
